Build beautiful applications with Svelte 5 and Tailwind CSS

## Why Eden UI?

<CardGrid stagger>
  <Card title="100+ Components" icon="puzzle">
    Comprehensive component library covering buttons, forms, navigation, data display, feedback, and more.
  </Card>
  <Card title="Svelte 5 Native" icon="rocket">
    Built from the ground up with Svelte 5 runes for optimal performance and developer experience.
  </Card>
  <Card title="20 Color Themes" icon="sun">
    Every component supports 20 color variants out of the box, with full dark mode support.
  </Card>
  <Card title="Type Safe" icon="approve-check">
    Full TypeScript support with automatic prop inference via tailwind-variants.
  </Card>
  <Card title="Accessible" icon="heart">
    WCAG 2.1 AA compliant with proper ARIA attributes and keyboard navigation.
  </Card>
  <Card title="Tree Shakeable" icon="document">
    Only bundle what you use. Each component is independently importable.
  </Card>

## Quick Install

```bash
pnpm add eden-ui
```

```svelte
<script>
  import { Button, Card, Alert } from 'eden-ui';
</script>

<Card color="primary" shadow="lg">
  <Alert color="green">Welcome to Eden UI!</Alert>
  <Button color="primary">Get Started</Button>
</Card>
```
Understanding Eden UI's design token system for colors, spacing, typography, and more

import { Aside } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

# Design Tokens

Design tokens are the foundational values that define Eden UI's visual language. They ensure consistency across all components.

## Color Tokens

Eden UI uses Tailwind CSS's default color palette, extended with semantic naming:

### Primary Palette

| Token | Light Mode | Dark Mode | Usage |
|-------|------------|-----------|-------|
| `primary-50` | `#eff6ff` | - | Subtle backgrounds |
| `primary-100` | `#dbeafe` | - | Light backgrounds |
| `primary-500` | `#3b82f6` | - | Default state |
| `primary-600` | `#2563eb` | - | Hover state |
| `primary-700` | `#1d4ed8` | - | Active state |

### Semantic Colors

| Purpose | Color | Token |
|---------|-------|-------|
| Success | Green | `green-500`, `emerald-500` |
| Warning | Yellow/Amber | `yellow-500`, `amber-500` |
| Error | Red | `red-500` |
| Info | Blue | `blue-500`, `sky-500` |

## Spacing Scale

Based on Tailwind's default 4px base unit:

| Token | Value | Usage |
|-------|-------|-------|
| `0` | 0px | No spacing |
| `1` | 4px | Tight spacing |
| `2` | 8px | Compact spacing |
| `3` | 12px | Default inline |
| `4` | 16px | Default block |
| `6` | 24px | Section spacing |
| `8` | 32px | Large spacing |

## Typography Scale

| Token | Size | Line Height | Usage |
|-------|------|-------------|-------|
| `text-xs` | 12px | 16px | Labels, captions |
| `text-sm` | 14px | 20px | Secondary text |
| `text-base` | 16px | 24px | Body text |
| `text-lg` | 18px | 28px | Large body |
| `text-xl` | 20px | 28px | Subheadings |
| `text-2xl` | 24px | 32px | Headings |

## Border Radius

| Token | Value | Usage |
|-------|-------|-------|
| `rounded-none` | 0 | Sharp corners |
| `rounded-sm` | 2px | Subtle rounding |
| `rounded` | 4px | Default |
| `rounded-md` | 6px | Medium rounding |
| `rounded-lg` | 8px | Cards, modals |
| `rounded-xl` | 12px | Large cards |
| `rounded-full` | 9999px | Pills, avatars |

## Shadow Scale

| Token | Usage |
|-------|-------|
| `shadow-sm` | Subtle elevation |
| `shadow` | Default cards |
| `shadow-md` | Dropdowns |
| `shadow-lg` | Modals |
| `shadow-xl` | Popovers |
| `shadow-2xl` | Dialogs |

## Using Tokens in Components

Tokens are applied via tailwind-variants:

```typescript
import { tv } from 'tailwind-variants';

export const card = tv({
  base: 'rounded-lg shadow-md p-4',
  variants: {
    size: {
      sm: 'p-3 rounded-md',
      md: 'p-4 rounded-lg',
      lg: 'p-6 rounded-xl',
    }
  }
});
```

<Aside type="tip">
  Use semantic tokens (like `primary`, `success`, `danger`) rather than raw color values for better maintainability and theme support.
</Aside>

## Customizing Tokens

Override tokens in your `tailwind.config.js`:

```js title="tailwind.config.js"
export default {
  theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        primary: {
          50: '#your-value',
          // ... custom primary scale
        }
      },
      spacing: {
        '18': '4.5rem',  // Custom spacing value
      }
    }
  }
}
```
Understanding Eden UI's architecture, design decisions, and project structure

import { FileTree, Aside } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; # Architecture Overview Eden UI is built with a focus on developer experience, performance, and maintainability. ## Technology Stack | Layer | Technology | Purpose | |-------|------------|---------| | **Framework** | Svelte 5 | Component runtime with runes | | **Styling** | Tailwind CSS 4 | Utility-first CSS | | **Variants** | tailwind-variants | Type-safe variant composition | | **Build** | Vite + SvelteKit | Development and packaging | | **Types** | TypeScript | Full type safety | ## Project Structure - src/ - lib/ - accordion/ # Each component has its own folder - Accordion.svelte - AccordionItem.svelte - theme.ts # tailwind-variants definitions - index.ts # Exports - alert/ - buttons/ - card/ - forms/ - input-field/ - select/ - checkbox/ - modal/ - table/ - ...100+ components - index.ts # Main library exports - routes/ # Documentation site - workshop/ # Component stories (Bookemoji) - docs/ # Starlight documentation - static/ # Static assets ## Component Architecture ### Standard Component Structure Every Eden UI component follows this pattern: ``` component-name/ ComponentName.svelte # Main component theme.ts # tailwind-variants styling index.ts # Exports SubComponent.svelte # Optional sub-components ``` ### Theme Files Theme files use `tailwind-variants` for type-safe, composable styling: ```typescript title="src/lib/buttons/theme.ts" import { tv, type VariantProps } from 'tailwind-variants'; export type ButtonVariants = VariantProps; export const button = tv({ base: 'inline-flex items-center justify-center font-medium transition-colors focus:outline-none focus:ring-2', variants: { color: { primary: 'bg-primary-600 text-white hover:bg-primary-700', secondary: 'bg-gray-200 text-gray-900 hover:bg-gray-300', // ... 18 more colors }, size: { xs: 'px-2 py-1 text-xs', sm: 'px-3 py-1.5 text-sm', md: 'px-4 py-2 text-sm', lg: 'px-5 py-2.5 text-base', xl: 'px-6 py-3 text-lg', }, outline: { true: 'bg-transparent border', }, pill: { true: 'rounded-full', false: 'rounded-lg', }, shadow: { true: 'shadow-lg', }, }, compoundVariants: [ // Outline + Color combinations { outline: true, color: 'primary', class: 'border-primary-600 text-primary-600 hover:bg-primary-50', }, // ... compound variants for all colors ], defaultVariants: { size: 'md', color: 'primary', pill: false, }, }); ``` ### Component Files Components use Svelte 5 runes and compose with their theme: ```svelte title="src/lib/buttons/Button.svelte" {#if href} {@render children?.()} {:else} {/if} ``` ## Design Decisions ### Why tailwind-variants? 1. **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript inference for all variant combinations 2. **Composability**: Extend base themes for custom variants 3. **Performance**: Compiles to static class strings at build time 4. **Readability**: Clear variant definitions in one place ### Why Svelte 5 Runes? 1. **Explicit Reactivity**: `$state`, `$derived`, `$effect` are explicit 2. **Better TypeScript**: Props type inference is automatic 3. **Snippets**: More flexible than slots for composition 4. **Performance**: Fine-grained reactivity without overhead ### Color System (20 Colors) We support 20 colors to cover: - **Brand Colors**: primary, secondary - **Semantic Colors**: red (error), green (success), yellow (warning), blue (info) - **Full Spectrum**: All Tailwind color families for design flexibility
Every component that supports colors implements all 20 variants consistently.
## Bundle Architecture Eden UI is published as a single package with tree-shaking support: ``` dist/ index.js # Main ESM bundle index.d.ts # TypeScript definitions accordion/ # Individual component chunks buttons/ ... styles.css # Optional base styles ``` Importing specific components only bundles what you use: ```svelte // Only Button and Card are included in your bundle import { Button, Card } from 'eden-ui'; ``` ## Next Steps - [Design Tokens](/architecture/design-tokens) - Color, spacing, typography tokens - [Theming System](/architecture/theming) - How theming works internally - [Contributing](/contributing) - Contribute to Eden UI
How Eden UI's theming system works under the hood

# Button

Buttons trigger actions or navigation. Eden UI buttons support extensive customization while maintaining accessibility.

## Live Demo

<WorkshopEmbed story="buttons/Button" height="300px" />

## Import

```svelte
import { Button } from 'eden-ui';
```

## Basic Usage

```svelte
<Button>Default Button</Button>
<Button color="primary">Primary</Button>
<Button color="green">Success</Button>
<Button color="red">Danger</Button>
```

## Variants

### Colors

All 20 color variants:

```svelte
<Button color="primary">Primary</Button>
<Button color="secondary">Secondary</Button>
<Button color="gray">Gray</Button>
<Button color="red">Red</Button>
<Button color="orange">Orange</Button>
<Button color="amber">Amber</Button>
<Button color="yellow">Yellow</Button>
<Button color="lime">Lime</Button>
<Button color="green">Green</Button>
<Button color="emerald">Emerald</Button>
<Button color="teal">Teal</Button>
<Button color="cyan">Cyan</Button>
<Button color="sky">Sky</Button>
<Button color="blue">Blue</Button>
<Button color="indigo">Indigo</Button>
<Button color="violet">Violet</Button>
<Button color="purple">Purple</Button>
<Button color="fuchsia">Fuchsia</Button>
<Button color="pink">Pink</Button>
<Button color="rose">Rose</Button>
```

### Sizes

```svelte
<Button size="xs">Extra Small</Button>
<Button size="sm">Small</Button>
<Button size="md">Medium (default)</Button>
<Button size="lg">Large</Button>
<Button size="xl">Extra Large</Button>
```

### Outline

```svelte
<Button outline>Outline Default</Button>
<Button color="primary" outline>Outline Primary</Button>
<Button color="red" outline>Outline Danger</Button>
```

### Pill (Rounded)

```svelte
<Button pill>Pill Button</Button>
<Button color="primary" pill>Primary Pill</Button>
```

### With Shadow

```svelte
<Button shadow>Shadow</Button>
<Button color="primary" shadow>Primary Shadow</Button>
<Button color="green" shadow>Success Shadow</Button>
```

### Disabled State

```svelte
<Button disabled>Disabled</Button>
<Button color="primary" disabled>Disabled Primary</Button>
```

## With Icons

```svelte
<script>
  import { Button } from 'eden-ui';
  import { PlusIcon, ArrowRightIcon } from 'lucide-svelte';
</script>

<!-- Icon before text -->
<Button>
  <PlusIcon class="w-4 h-4 mr-2" />
  Add Item
</Button>

<!-- Icon after text -->
<Button color="primary">
  Continue
  <ArrowRightIcon class="w-4 h-4 ml-2" />
</Button>

<!-- Icon only -->
<Button color="gray" aria-label="Add">
  <PlusIcon class="w-5 h-5" />
</Button>
```

<Aside type="tip">
  When using icon-only buttons, always include an `aria-label` for accessibility.
</Aside>

## Button Groups

```svelte
<script>
  import { Button, ButtonGroup } from 'eden-ui';
</script>

<ButtonGroup>
  <Button>Left</Button>
  <Button>Middle</Button>
  <Button>Right</Button>
</ButtonGroup>
```

## Loading State

```svelte
<script>
  import { Button, Spinner } from 'eden-ui';

  let loading = $state(false);

  async function handleClick() {
    loading = true;
    await doSomething();
    loading = false;
  }
</script>

<Button onclick={handleClick} disabled={loading}>
  {#if loading}
    <Spinner size="sm" class="mr-2" />
    Loading...
  {:else}
    Submit
  {/if}
</Button>
```

## As Link

```svelte
<Button href="/dashboard">Go to Dashboard</Button>
<Button href="https://example.com" target="_blank">External Link</Button>
```

## Props

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `color` | `'primary' \| 'secondary' \| 'gray' \| ...` | `'primary'` | Button color variant |
| `size` | `'xs' \| 'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg' \| 'xl'` | `'md'` | Button size |
| `outline` | `boolean` | `false` | Use outline style |
| `pill` | `boolean` | `false` | Use fully rounded corners |
| `shadow` | `boolean` | `false` | Add drop shadow |
| `disabled` | `boolean` | `false` | Disable the button |
| `href` | `string` | - | Render as `<a>` tag |
| `target` | `string` | - | Link target (when href is set) |
| `class` | `string` | - | Additional CSS classes |

## Accessibility

- Buttons use native `<button>` elements (or `<a>` when `href` is provided)
- Focus states are clearly visible with ring indicators
- Disabled buttons are properly marked with `aria-disabled`
- Color contrast meets WCAG AA standards

- [GradientButton](/components/gradient-button) - Gradient background variants

How to install and configure Eden UI in your SvelteKit project

import { Tabs, TabItem, Steps } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; # Installation Eden UI is designed for SvelteKit projects using Svelte 5 and Tailwind CSS. ## Prerequisites - Node.js 18+ - SvelteKit 2.0+ with Svelte 5 - Tailwind CSS 3.4+ ## Package Installation ```bash pnpm add eden-ui ``` ```bash npm install eden-ui ``` ```bash yarn add eden-ui ``` ## Configuration 1. **Configure Tailwind CSS** Add Eden UI to your `tailwind.config.js` content paths: ```js title="tailwind.config.js" /** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */ export default { content: [ './src/**/*.{html,js,svelte,ts}', './node_modules/eden-ui/**/*.{html,js,svelte,ts}' // Add this line ], darkMode: 'class', theme: { extend: {}, }, plugins: [], } ``` 2. **Import Base Styles** Import Eden UI's base styles in your root layout: ```svelte title="src/routes/+layout.svelte" ``` 3. **Start Using Components** Import and use components in your Svelte files: ```svelte title="src/routes/+page.svelte"

Hello Eden UI!

Active ``` ## TypeScript Support Eden UI is written in TypeScript and provides full type definitions. Component props are automatically inferred: ```typescript import type { ButtonProps, CardProps } from 'eden-ui'; // Full IntelliSense for all component props const buttonConfig: ButtonProps = { color: 'primary', // Autocomplete for 20 color options size: 'lg', // Type-safe size variants outline: true, disabled: false }; ``` ## Tree Shaking Eden UI supports tree shaking out of the box. Only the components you import will be included in your bundle: ```svelte // Only Button and Card are bundled import { Button, Card } from 'eden-ui'; ``` ## Dark Mode Eden UI supports dark mode via Tailwind's `class` strategy. Toggle dark mode by adding/removing the `dark` class on your `` element: ```svelte ``` ## Next Steps - [Quick Start Guide](/getting-started/quick-start) - Build your first page - [Theming](/getting-started/theming) - Customize colors and styles - [Components](/components) - Browse all available components
Eden UI is a comprehensive design system and component library built with Svelte 5

import { Card, CardGrid } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; # Welcome to Eden UI Eden UI is a modern, accessible, and highly customizable component library built with **Svelte 5** and **Tailwind CSS**. It provides 100+ production-ready components designed for building beautiful web applications. ## Key Features Built from the ground up with Svelte 5 runes (`$props`, `$state`, `$derived`) for optimal performance and developer experience. Powered by tailwind-variants for type-safe, composable styling with automatic TypeScript inference. Every component supports 20 color variants out of the box, with full dark mode support. WCAG 2.1 AA compliant with proper ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support. ## Quick Example ```svelte

Welcome Back!

You have 3 new notifications.

Your account has been verified!
``` ## Component Categories ### Core Components Foundational UI elements like buttons, badges, alerts, cards, and typography. ### Form Components Complete form solution with inputs, selects, checkboxes, radio buttons, and validation states. ### Navigation Navbars, sidebars, breadcrumbs, tabs, and pagination components. ### Data Display Tables, lists, timelines, and progress indicators. ### Feedback Modals, drawers, toasts, popovers, and tooltips. ### Marketing UI Pre-built sections for landing pages, hero sections, CTAs, and testimonials. ### Application UI Dashboard widgets, CRUD layouts, settings pages, and authentication forms. ## Getting Started Ready to build? Check out our [Installation Guide](/getting-started/installation) to add Eden UI to your project.
Build your first page with Eden UI in under 5 minutes

import { Steps, Aside } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; # Quick Start Let's build a simple dashboard card using Eden UI components. ## What We're Building A stats card that displays key metrics with an icon, value, and trend indicator. ## Implementation 1. **Create the Component** ```svelte title="src/lib/components/StatsCard.svelte"

{title}

{value}

{#if trend !== 0} {trendSign}{trend}% {/if}
{#if Icon}
{/if}
``` 2. **Use in a Page** ```svelte title="src/routes/dashboard/+page.svelte"
``` 3. **Result** You now have a responsive dashboard with three stat cards showing: - User count with positive trend (green badge) - Order count with negative trend (red badge) - Revenue with positive trend (green badge) ## Key Concepts ### Props with $props() Svelte 5 uses `$props()` runes instead of `export let`: ```svelte // Svelte 5 (Eden UI) let { color, size }: Props = $props(); // Instead of Svelte 4 export let color; export let size; ``` ### Derived State Use `$derived()` for computed values: ```svelte const trendColor = $derived(trend >= 0 ? 'green' : 'red'); ``` ### Component Composition Eden UI components are designed to compose together: ```svelte New ```
Check out our [Patterns](/patterns) section for more complex component compositions and real-world examples.
